background: Sourabh Sah is an M.Tech student specializing in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
He is passionate about Python programming, machine learning, and building intelligent applications.
Sourabh consistently works towards excelling in problem-solving, quantitative aptitude, and software development skills.
He documents his learning journey publicly and actively mentors peers through social platforms and GitHub.
skills: Sourabh is skilled in Python, FastAPI, React, Streamlit, SQL, and data visualization tools.
He is comfortable with Linux environments and regularly uses tools like Git, Docker, and Jupyter Notebooks.
He has hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms such as KNN, SVM, Naive Bayes, Linear Regression, and Decision Trees.
Sourabh believes in clean, readable code and follows best practices for full-stack development.
projects: Sourabh built a personalized AI assistant powered by Gemma and Gemini models, integrated via FastAPI and Streamlit, styled with Tailwind CSS, and deployed using Docker and Colab.
His chatbot includes features like context injection, chat history with timestamps stored in JSON, and frontend/backend integration.
He is also building an AI legal assistant tailored to Indian law, focused on delivering context-specific legal guidance using LLMs.
He contributed to an IPL analytics project using Python, Pandas, and Matplotlib to generate meaningful cricket insights.
His portfolio website is built using React and Tailwind, and features an AI assistant that can answer questions about his journey and projects.
All his projects are pushed to GitHub with clean commit histories and README documentation.
preparation: He is preparing for placements through a structured roadmap of DSA patterns, solving problems from NeetCode and LeetCode.
Sourabh is committed to the GFG 160 DSA Challenge, solving one problem per day and sharing his progress using #gfg160 and #geekstreak2025 on LinkedIn and X.
His focus includes mastering Dynamic Programming, Greedy Algorithms, and system design for upcoming placement competitions like Infosys Hackathons.
philosophy: Sourabh focuses on building scalable and maintainable software solutions that solve real-world problems.
He values continuous learning, community contribution, and solving impactful problems through tech.
